title: Hold Thngs Memory
message:
Programs are made up of values stored in memory and actions to take on those values

Values being things like numbers, strings, booleans, and more

in order to hang onto values they must be assigned to a variable or in ES6 a const or let

var: is the keyword to declare a variable. Variables can be unassigned, and can be reassigned to any value. Variables are also hoisted to the top of their function scope, or global scope if they're declared outside of a function.

const: is the keyword to declare constants. Constants must be assigned at declaration and cannot be reassigned. Constants are hoisted to the top of their function scope, or global scope if declared outside of a function.

let: is the keyword to declare a block scoped variable. Lets can be unassigned, and can be reassigned to any value. Lets are hoisted to the top of the block of code in which they are declared. This means they are scoped to if statements or loops
